title: Cell-probe lower bounds for dynamic problems via a new communication model.
abstract: In this paper, we develop a new communication model to prove a data structure lower bound for the dynamic interval union problem. The problem is to maintain a multiset of intervals  I  over [0,  n ] with integer coordinates, supporting the following operations: 1)  insert(a, b) , add an interval [ a ,  b ] to  I , provided that  a  and  b  are integers in [0,  n ]; 2)  delete(a, b) , delete an (existing) interval [ a ,  b ] from  I ; 3)  query() , return the total length of the union of all intervals in  I .   It is related to the two-dimensional case of Klee’s measure problem. We prove that there is a distribution over sequences of operations with  O ( n ) insertions and deletions, and  O ( n  0.01 ) queries, for which any data structure with any constant error probability requires Ω( n log n ) time in expectation. Interestingly, we use the sparse set disjointness protocol of Hastad and Wigderson to speed up a reduction from a new kind of nondeterministic communication games, for which we prove lower bounds.   For applications, we prove lower bounds for several dynamic graph problems by reducing them from dynamic interval union.
